revised_title: The Development of the Ungulate Placenta and Comparative Analysis of Placental Types in Various Mammals
tldr: This study examines the morphology and development of the ungulate placenta, particularly in sheep, and compares it to the placenta of the elephant and hyrax. The author proposes two main types of placentation: plicate and cumulate, based on the behavior of the trophoblast. The placental development in ungulates shows a closer connection to the Proboscidea, Sirenia, and Carnivora, while the hyracoidea's placenta has a different, cumulate type more similar to certain Insectivora.
